extDescription.message: Browser extension for tldw_server - your unified AI assistant with RAG, media processing, and more.

contextSaveToNotesNoSelection.message: Select text first to save to Notes.

contextSaveToNotesDeliveryFailed.message: Could not open the sidebar to save this note. Check that the tldw Assistant sidebar is allowed on this site and try again.

hfSendPageRejected.message: [tldw] Page send request rejected by tldw_server

hfSendPageErrorWithDetail.message: [tldw] Failed to send this page to tldw_server: $1. Check Settings → tldw server and try again.

hfSendPageError.message: [tldw] Failed to send this page to tldw_server. Check Settings → tldw server and try again.

hfSendPageSuccess.message: [tldw] Sent page to tldw_server for processing

hfSendPageException.message: [tldw] Something went wrong while sending this page to tldw_server. Check that your tldw_server and the extension are running, then try again.

hfPullInProgress.message: [tldw Assistant] A model pull request is already in progress. Please wait for it to finish before starting another one.

hfPullConfirm.message: [tldw Assistant] Do you want to send a request to your tldw_server to pull the "$1" model? This is independent of the huggingface.co website. Your server will start pulling the model after you confirm.

hfPullSending.message: [tldw Assistant] Sending a request to your tldw_server to pull "$1". Check the extension icon or your tldw_server logs for progress.

hfPullErrorWithDetail.message: [tldw Assistant] Failed to send a pull request for "$1": $2. Check Settings → tldw server and try again.

hfPullError.message: [tldw Assistant] Failed to send a pull request for "$1". Check Settings → tldw server and try again.

hfPullSuccess.message: [tldw Assistant] Request sent to your tldw_server to pull "$1". Monitor the extension icon or tldw_server logs for status.

hfPullException.message: [tldw Assistant] Something went wrong while sending a pull request for "$1" to your tldw_server. Check that your tldw_server and the extension are running, then try again.

footerHelp.message: Once connected, you can revisit these settings anytime from the extension menu.
footerHelp.description: Onboarding footer help text in Settings.

progressAria.description: Aria label for onboarding progress indicator.

stepLabel.description: Label for the first onboarding step (welcome).

path.message: How would you like to get started?
path.description: Heading for choosing how to get started in onboarding.

authModeHelp.message: Single User (API Key) is recommended for personal or small-team servers. Multi User (Login) is for shared deployments where people sign in with usernames or SSO. Choose the mode that matches how your tldw_server is set up.
authModeHelp.description: Help text explaining Single User vs Multi User authentication modes.

apiKeyHelp.message: Find your API key in tldw_server → Settings → API Keys. Generate a key there and paste it here.
apiKeyHelp.description: Help text describing where to find the API key.

authStepAria.message: Step {{current}} of {{total}} — Choose how you sign in
authStepAria.description: Aria label for the authentication step in onboarding.

confirmStepAria.message: Step {{current}} of {{total}} — Confirm connection and review next steps
confirmStepAria.description: Aria label for the confirmation step in onboarding.

nextSteps.description: Title for the final onboarding panel describing next steps.

notesEmpty_connectDescription.message: To use Notes, first connect to your tldw server.

notesEmpty_connectExample1.message: Open Settings → tldw server to add your server URL.

notesEmpty_connectExample2.message: Use Diagnostics if your server is running but not reachable.

notesEmpty_demoDescription.message: This demo shows how Notes can organize your insights. Connect your own server later to create and save real notes.

notesEmpty_demoExample1.message: See how note titles, previews, and timestamps appear in the list.

notesEmpty_demoExample2.message: When you connect, you’ll be able to create notes from meetings, reviews, and more.

notesEmpty_demoExample3.message: Use Notes alongside Media and Review to keep track of your findings.

notesEmpty_demoSample1Preview.message: Decisions, blockers, and follow-ups from a recent team sync.

notesEmpty_demoSample2Preview.message: Key insights pulled from a long article or paper.

notesEmpty_demoSample3Preview.message: Summary of a customer call with next steps and owners.

notesEmpty_description.message: Capture and organize free-form notes connected to your tldw insights.

notesEmpty_exampleCreate.message: Create a new note for a recent meeting or transcript.

notesEmpty_exampleLink.message: Save review outputs into Notes so you can revisit them later.

headerShortcuts.message: Show quick shortcuts in the header
headerShortcuts.description: Setting option to show quick shortcuts in the header during onboarding.

error_friendlyApiKeySummary.message: We couldn't reach your tldw server.

error_friendlyApiKeyHint.message: Your API key may be invalid. Open Settings → tldw server to check your URL and API key, then try again.

error_friendlyTimeoutHint.message: The server stopped streaming responses. Try again, or open Health & diagnostics to check server status.

contentReview_emptyDescription.message: No drafts yet. Use Quick Ingest with Review before saving to create drafts.

contentReview_reviewBeforeStorageHint.message: Process now, then edit drafts locally before committing to your server.

contentReview_reviewWarningBody.message: Drafts are saved in this browser and may include sensitive data. You can clear drafts from the Content Review page at any time.

contentReview_reviewWarningBodySecondary.message: Review mode keeps content client-side until you commit it to your server.

contentReview_reviewStorageCapWarning_on.message: {{count}} file exceeds the local draft cap ({{cap}}). Attach sources before committing audio/video.

contentReview_reviewStorageCapWarning_ot.message: {{count}} files exceed the local draft cap ({{cap}}). Attach sources before committing audio/video.

contentReview_selectDraft.message: Select a draft to begin reviewing.

contentReview_resetBody.message: This will restore the original content for this draft.

contentReview_aiHint.message: Sends draft content to your server for AI processing.

contentReview_aiConsentBody.message: This will send the draft content to your tldw server for AI processing. Drafts stay local until you commit.

contentReview_detectSectionsBody.message: This will replace existing sections and reset your selections.

contentReview_templates_transcript_clean.message: Normalize punctuation and casing while preserving line structure.

contentReview_templates_speaker_turns_de.message: Ensure each speaker turn is on its own line with clear labels.

contentReview_templates_chapter_headings.message: Insert Markdown headings to group topics without removing content.

contentReview_missingSourceBody.message: Attach the original file to commit this draft.

contentReview_commitDisabled.message: Attach the original audio/video file before committing.

contentReview_discardBody.message: This draft will be marked as discarded and removed from review.

contentReview_commitAllBody.message: Only drafts marked as reviewed will be committed.

contentReview_storageCapWarning.message: This file exceeds the local draft cap ({{cap}}).

contentReview_clearBody.message: This removes all local content review drafts and assets.

reviewNavigationRetry.description: Button label to retry opening Content Review.

quickIngest_subtitle.message: Enter one or more URLs. Force type per row if needed.

quickIngest_offlineBypassDescription.message: Items are staged here and will process once you disable offline mode or re-enable live server checks.

quickIngest_processOnlyHelp.message: Process only and keep results local (download JSON).

quickIngest_storageServerDescription.message: Stored on your tldw server (recommended for RAG and shared workspaces).

quickIngest_storageLocalDescription.message: Kept in this browser only; no data written to your server.

quickIngest_reviewWarningBodySecondary.message: Review mode keeps content client-side until you commit it to your server.

playground_composer_contextMediaHint.message: Attach Media & Notes that should steer the response.

playground_composer_contextTabsHint.message: Review or remove referenced tabs, or add more from your open browser tabs.

playground_composer_persistence_ephemera.message: Temporary chat: not saved in history and cleared when you close this window.

playground_composer_persistence_local.message: Saved locally in this browser only (not synced to your tldw server).

playground_composer_persistence_saveToSe.message: Also save this chat to server

playground_composer_persistence_connectT.message: Connect your server to save chats there.

playground_composer_persistence_serverSa.message: Future messages in this chat will sync to your tldw server.

playground_composer_persistence_serverBe.message: This keeps a durable record in server history so you can reopen the conversation later, access it from other browsers, and run server-side analytics over your chats.

playground_composer_persistence_serverCh.message: Unable to find or create a default assistant character on the server. Try again from the Characters page.
Create a simple assistant persona (name and a short description are enough). Once it exists, the extension can reuse it when saving chats to your server.

playground_composer_persistence_serverIn.message: This chat is stored both in this browser and on your tldw server, so you can reopen it from server history, keep a long-term record, and analyze it alongside other conversations.

playground_composer_stateHelp.message: Default state is “in-progress.” Update it as the conversation progresses.

playground_composer_saveSnippetHelp.message: Store this message as a knowledge snippet with a backlink to this conversation.

playground_composer_saveSnippetError.message: Failed to save snippet. Check your connection and try again.

playground_composer_connectToSend.message: Connect to your tldw server in Settings to send messages and view media.

playground_composer_compareSettingsToggl.message: Send your next message to multiple models.

playground_composer_compareActiveModelsH.message: Your next message will be sent to each active model.

playground_composer_compareMaxModels.message: You can compare up to {{limit}} models per turn.

playground_composer_compareMaxModelsTrim.message: Compare is limited to {{limit}} models per turn. Using the first {{limit}} selected models.

playground_composer_compareContinueHint.message: Continue this chat with the selected model.

playground_composer_validationCompareSel.message: Select at least one model for Compare mode.

playground_actor_help.message: Configure per-chat scene context: roles, mood, world, goals, and notes.

playground_actor_addLabel.message: Add or remove aspects to focus the scene.

playground_actor_notesHelp.message: Optional notes sent to the model. Supports Markdown and LaTeX.

playground_actor_depthHelp.message: Used only when position is "In-chat at depth". Counts non-system messages from the top of the chat.

playground_actor_positionHelp.message: Depth is only used when position is "In-chat at depth". Role controls whether Actor appears as system, user, or assistant.

playground_actor_offlineHintTitle.message: World Books not available for Actor

playground_actor_offlineHintBody.message: Connect to your tldw server from Settings to use World Books for Actor aspects, or keep using free-text values.

playground_actor_loreWorldBookMissing.message: Previous world book binding was not found; using free text instead.

playground_actor_loreEntryMissing.message: Previous world book entry was not found; using free text instead.

playground_actor_tokensHelp.message: Use these tokens in prompts and system messages.

playground_actor_keyChangeBody.message: This will change the token from {{old}} to {{next}}. Prompts using the old token won't update automatically.

playground_actor_keyCollisionBody.message: Another aspect already uses this key. Keys must be unique per chat.

playground_actor_aspectLimitWarningTitle.message: Many aspects configured for this chat

playground_actor_aspectLimitWarningBody.message: You have {{count}} aspects (soft limit {{limit}}). Consider trimming to focus the scene and save tokens.

playground_actor_tokenWarning.message: Actor prompt is long ({{count}} tokens; soft limit {{limit}}). Consider trimming aspects or notes to save context.

playground_actor_depthRangeHelp.message: Depth must be between 0 and 999; values beyond history length are clamped.

playground_actor_notesGmOnly.message: GM-only: do not send notes to the model

playground_actor_templateModeHelp.message: Controls how Actor interacts with active scene templates. Merge keeps both; Override lets Actor replace overlapping fields; Ignore skips Actor when templates are active.

playground_actor_summaryTokensEmpty.message: No tokens defined yet; set aspect values.

playground_actor_sceneTemplateActive.message: Scene template active: Actor respects template interaction settings.

playground_tts_subtitle.message: Try out text-to-speech and tweak providers, models, and voices.

playground_tts_settingsIntro.message: Adjust your TTS provider, model, and voice. These settings are reused when you play audio from chat or media.

playground_tts_inputLabel.message: Enter some text to hear it spoken.

playground_tts_inputPlaceholder.message: Type or paste text here, then use Play to listen.

playground_tts_playHelper.message: Play uses your selected provider, voice, and speed.

playground_tts_playDisabledTtsOff.message: Enable text-to-speech above to play audio.

playground_tts_playDisabledElevenLabs.message: Add an ElevenLabs API key, voice, and model to enable Play.

playground_tts_providerChangeHelper.message: Open the provider selector below to switch between Browser, tldw, OpenAI, or Supersonic.

playground_tts_browserSegmentsHelp.message: Queue segments or play an individual segment using system audio.

playground_tts_tldwStatusOffline.message: Audio API not detected; check your tldw server version.

playground_tts_tldwWarningBody.message: Ensure your tldw_server version includes /api/v1/audio/speech and that your extension is connected with a valid API key.

playground_tts_speechErrorBody.message: Transcription request failed. Check tldw server health.

playground_tts_speechNoText.message: The transcription did not return any text.

playground_tts_speechMicError.message: Unable to access your microphone. Check browser permissions and try again.

playground_tts_playErrorDescription.message: Something went wrong while trying to play the audio

playground_tts_browserInfoDescription.message: Browser TTS plays using your system synthesizer and does not expose a downloadable audio file. Use the segment controls below, or switch providers for a track list and player.

playground_tts_unsupportedProviderDescri.message: The provider "{{provider}}" is not yet supported in the playground player.

playground_tts_elevenLabsMissingBody.message: Add your ElevenLabs API key in Settings to load voices and models.

playground_tts_elevenLabsUnavailableBody.message: We couldn't load voices or models. Check your API key and try again.

playground_tts_generateErrorDescription.message: Something went wrong while generating TTS audio.

playground_tldwState_subtitle.message: We’re pinging {{host}} to verify the connection.

playground_tldwState_notRunning.message: Unable to connect to tldw server 🚨

playground_tldwState_noServer.message: Add your tldw server to start chatting.

playground_tldwState_connectedSubtitle.message: Connected to {{host}}. Start chatting when you’re ready.

playground_tldwState_errorSubtitle.message: We couldn’t reach {{host}} yet. Retry or update your server settings.

playground_tldwState_missingHelp.message: Open Settings → tldw Server to add your URL or connect to the Options page.

playground_tldwState_troubleshoot.message: Confirm your server is running and that the browser is allowed to reach it, then retry from the Options page.

playground_errors_privateModeDescription.message: Firefox Private Mode does not support saving chat. Temporary chat is enabled by default. More fixes coming soon.

quiz_optionsRequired.message: Please provide at least two options.

quiz_answerAll.message: Please answer all questions before submitting.

manageCharacters_tags_help.message: Use tags to group characters by use case (e.g., “writing”, “teaching”).

manageCharacters_confirm_delete.message: Are you sure you want to delete this character? This action cannot be undone.

manageCharacters_avatar_formatError.message: Only PNG, JPEG, and GIF images are supported

manageCharacters_avatar_dropzone.message: Click or drag image to upload

manageCharacters_form_description.message: Define a reusable character you can chat with in the sidebar.

manageCharacters_form_systemPrompt_place.message: E.g., You are a patient math teacher who explains concepts step by step and checks understanding with short examples.

manageCharacters_form_systemPrompt_help.message: Explain the character's role, tone, and constraints. For example: "You are a patient math tutor who explains concepts step by step."

manageCharacters_form_systemPrompt_requi.message: Please add instructions to guide responses.

manageCharacters_form_systemPrompt_min.message: Provide instructions so the character responds appropriately.

manageCharacters_form_systemPrompt_max.message: System prompt must be 2000 characters or less.

manageCharacters_form_greeting_placehold.message: Hi there! I’m your writing coach. Paste your draft and I’ll help you tighten it up.

manageCharacters_form_greeting_help.message: Optional first message the character will send when you start a chat.

manageCharacters_notification_someError.message: Something went wrong. Please try again later

manageCharacters_loadError_description.message: Check your connection and try again.

manageCharacters_emptyDescription.message: Create a reusable character with a name, description, and system prompt you can chat with.

manageCharacters_emptyExample1.message: Define a writing coach, lore expert, or coding assistant you can reuse across chats.

manageCharacters_emptyExample2.message: Give each character a clear description and behavior so their responses stay consistent.
